11321.content:
Krillin smiled and waved at Yamcha as he landed outside the Kame house. Yamcha was another soul that shared his pain. Yamcha had always been strong but he'd never made too much of a name for himself. In every fight he'd been in he'd almost always end up getting hurt, killed, or beaten in some way. Krillin was about to ask him what was going on when Yamcha grabbed him by the shoulders and said, "Krillin this is our chance!"

Krillin looked surprised as Yamcha started grinning at him. Krillin laughed a little and said, "What are you talking about?"

Yamcha laughed and said, "All the strongest guys are gone in space to help some strange planet out in the East Galaxy and we have a situation here on Earth!"

Krillin's heart leaped as he heard this. "Wh-Why is that a good thing?!?"

Yamcha turned back to Krillin and said, "Someone's attacking the planet and you haven't even sensed their ki yet right? Well Tien is fighting this guy right now and he's been kicking butt! Whoever this guy is he's a total wuss! We'll be heroes again if we take him out!"

Krillin liked the sound of that. If it was only for a moment, he wanted to be back in that spotlight. He flew up into the air, Yamcha right behind him and said, "Where to?"

Yamcha turned and said, "Follow me!"

It only took about fifteen minutes of flying to reach the city where the attack was being held. Tien was indeed already there and fighting what appeared to be a small man wearing a tank on his back. He was currently getting his butt handed to him by Tien. Yamcha and Krillin landed just behind Tien who turned around and said, "I can handle this guy on my own you guys."

Yamcha snorted and said, "Not likely! This is all of our chances, not just yours!"

As Yamcha and Tien argued, the man got to his feet, a little shakily, and said, "Now I finally have you where I want you! I've waited years for this moment when the World's Strongest fighters would be gone for me to attack. Now the Dragonballs will be mine and the world will be mine!"

Krillin glanced at the guy and said, "You're still out of your league here little guy. Once we're done talking you're going to get hurt so you might want to surrender."

The man stomped his feet angrily and said, "No, no no! You three will die right now! Prepare to taste by poison developed from the world's most lethal animals!"

A needle suddenly darted out of the tank and stabbed Krillin in the arm. Before he could react Tien and Yamcha were also stabbed. A strange burning green liquid was injected into them causing them all to wince in pain. The man giggled insanely and said, "In a few seconds you'll all be dead and no one will stand in my way! I'll be an all powerful, immortal king!"

Minutes ticked by and nothing seemed to happen.The man started looking worried. When ten minutes had passed and no one had done or said anything (and no one was dead) Yamcha laughed and said, "Your poison sucks little man!"

The man growled in anger again and said, "Then lets up the dosage!"

Several more needles darted out of the tank, stabbing the three humans all over their bodies, injecting them with more and more poison. Soon, the large tanks on the man's back was empty. And still neither of the humans were dead. The man fell to his knees and said, "Why isn't my poison working? This isn't how it was supposed to go!"

He pulled out a piece of paper and muttered, "Maybe I mistook the formula. Perhaps if I changed this..."

A small ki blast destroyed his plans causing him to cry out in sadness. Before he could even look up from the ashes, Yamcha landed a punch square on his head knocking him out. It took all of ten minutes to put the man in jail without his now empty tanks. Yamcha put an arm behind his head and said, "Well, maybe this wasn't the fight that'll put us back on the map after all."

Krillin sighed and said, "Thank you for a colossal waste of time. I'll see you guys later."

Krillin then flew home, not noticing a strange tightening in his clothes.

It was a time of peace in Dragonworld and Goku was taking some well deserved time off. Countless times he's saved the world and countless times he's been near death. It wasn't too much to ask for a little time off, was it? Apparently it was. Chi-Chi had been on his back nonstop about various things from cleaning to running chores. Gohan was busy with his studies and Goten was too young to do much so Chi-Chi focused on Goku. He was currently hiding out in Mount Paouzu far enough away from his house that Chi-Chi wouldn't be willing to walk to find him. Goku was relaxing by a mountain stream intending to catch some fish after resting so that Chi-Chi would let up on him a little. He sighed and sat up, watching the dark shadows moving under the sparkling surface of the water. He started stripping and got down to his underwear when something in the sky caught his eye. Shielding his eyes against the sun he watched as something came flying down, landing a few yards away!

"What the heck was that?" Goku wondered out loud, crossing his arms.

Curious, Goku left his clothes behind and flew towards where the thing had fallen. It was easy to find since it had made a crater about ten feet wide and twenty feet deep. Expecting the worst, Goku slowly made his way down into the hole. Surprisingly it wasn't an alien ship, egg, or other strange disturbance. It was just a rock. Goku grabbed it and turned it over in his hands. It was a bright silver color and as Goku turned it in the suns rays it sparkled like a star. Goku thought it looked really beautiful and an idea came to him.

"Chi-Chi would love this!" Goku said holding the rock up. "This is sure to make Chi-Chi leave me alone!"

Goku climbed out of the hole and flew back to his clothes, looking at the stone the whole way. He sighed and said, "Maybe Chi-Chi won't even care about this. I wish she'd just let me be me."

As Goku said these words out loud, the rock suddenly flashed a blinding white causing Goku to be temporarily blinded to the point that he crashed into the stream. Once his vision cleared, Goku made for the surface of the moving water and climbed out onto the bank, soaking wet. The rock was still in his hand but it had lost its lustrous silver shine. It was still glowing but a very dull silver color. Goku looked dismayed and thought, "Aww, now Chi-Chi really won't care about this rock! Oh well."

Goku didn't feel like throwing it away since it was probably one of kind. Stuff didn't just fall from the sky everyday you know. It was a short walk back to his clothes and Goku quickly got dressed. He shrugged his shoulders and moved his arms around a little. His clothes felt strangely tight. Usually his clothes were loose giving him greater maneuverability during fights. Now it felt like his undershirt was gripping tightly to his chest and stomach, riding up slightly while his orange shirt felt like it was straining to the point of nearly breaking near his shoulders. His pants weren't faring any better, no longer hanging loosely at his boots. Even his boxers felt tighter, hugging his legs to the point of feeling like briefs. He purposely pulled off his boots not liking how cramped his toes were. He shrugged it off. What did it matter if his clothes were a little tight? It was possible his clothes shrunk when he got wet and from sitting in the sun. Goku let that explanation suffice in his mind, not really realizing how impossible it was. He flew off, forgetting about the fish and hoping Chi-Chi had cooled down.
